133000. Archishop Heinrich II becomes Bishop of Münster

Bremen — Not random

Conditions

  • Münster exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Münster and Bremen are at war

Will happen within 300 days of January 2, 1466
Checked again every 300 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1466)

Description

In 1466 archbishop Heinrich II of Bremen became Bishop of Münster. He resided in Münster and neglected Bremen for the bishopric of Münster.

Actions

A. OK

  • +50 relations with Münster
  • +50 victory points

Back to top

133001. Archbishop Heinrich.

Bremen — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 235001 - Inheritance of Jülich and Guelders for Berg has already occurred
  • The following must not occur:
    • Münster and Bremen are allied

Will happen on January 2, 1467

Description

With his new throne Heinrich brought Münster into Bremen's alliance.

Actions

A. OK

  • Gain an alliance with Münster

Back to top

133002. The Brunswick-Lüneburg archbishops

Bremen — Not random

Conditions

  • Hanover exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Bremen and Hanover are at war

Will happen within 30 days of December 5, 1511
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 22, 1558)

Description

In 1511 Christoph of Brunswick-Lüneburg, a brother of the Duke, was elected Archbishop of Bremen. His successor Georg, elected in 1558, was a relative of him. Thereby, Bremen came under the influence of the Welfs.

Actions

A. OK

  • +50 relations with Hanover
  • Gain a royal marriage with Hanover
  • Event 181002 - Christoph of Brunswick-Lüneburg is elected Archbishop of Bremen for Hanover is triggered immediately

Back to top

133003. Christoph of Brunswick-Lüneburg is elected Archbishop of Bremen

Bremen — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 133002 - The Brunswick-Lüneburg archbishops for Bremen has already occurred
  • None of the following must occur:
    • Event 181002 - Christoph of Brunswick-Lüneburg is elected Archbishop of Bremen for Hanover has already occurred
    • Bremen and Hanover are allied
    • Bremen and Hanover are at war

Will happen within 20 days of December 30, 1511
Checked again every 20 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 22, 1558)

Description

With his new throne Christoph brought Brunswick into Bremen's alliance.

Actions

A. Vivat!

  • Gain an alliance with Hanover
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill +2 for 12 months

Back to top

133004. Heinrich of Saxony-Lauenburg, Archbishop of Bremen

Bremen — Not random

Conditions

  • Bremen is a vassal of Hanover

Will happen on December 5, 1566

Description

With the election of the Askanian Heinrich of Saxony-Lauenburg as administrator of the protestant archbishopric, the Welfs lost their influence in Bremen.

Actions

A. OK

  • Break vassalization with Hanover
  • Break royal marriage with Hanover
  • -70 relations with Hanover

Back to top

133005. Archbishops from Holstein-Gottorp

Bremen — Not random

Conditions

  • Holstein exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Bremen and Holstein are at war

Will happen within 20 days of April 29, 1585
Checked again every 20 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after August 29, 1596)

Description

In 1585 Johann Adolf, successor to the Duchy of Holstein-Gottorp was elected Archbishop of Bremen. Six years after becoming Duke, in 1596, he let the Archbishopric to his son Johann Friedrich. Both pursued a policy in the interest of Holstein-Gottorp and its Danish relatives.

Actions

A. OK

  • Discover Friesland
  • Gain a royal marriage with Denmark
  • +50 relations with Denmark
  • Gain a royal marriage with Holstein
  • +50 relations with Holstein
  • Event 279009 - Johann Adolf of Holstein-Gottorp is elected Archbishop of Bremen for Holstein is triggered immediately

Back to top

133006. Johann Adolf of Holstein-Gottorp is elected Archbishop of Bremen

Bremen — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 133005 - Archbishops from Holstein-Gottorp for Bremen has already occurred
  • None of the following must occur:
    • Event 279009 - Johann Adolf of Holstein-Gottorp is elected Archbishop of Bremen for Holstein has already occurred
    • Bremen and Holstein are allied
    • Bremen and Holstein are at war

Will happen within 20 days of April 30, 1585
Checked again every 20 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after August 29, 1596)

Description

With his new throne Johann Adolf brought Holstein-Gottorp into Bremen's alliance.

Actions

A. Vivat!

  • Gain an alliance with Holstein
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill +2 for 12 months

Back to top

133007. Fredrik III of Denmark, the last Archbishop of Bremen

Bremen — Not random

Conditions

  • Denmark exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Bremen and Denmark are at war

Will happen within 20 days of September 4, 1634
Checked again every 20 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after April 10, 1648)

Description

In 1634, the future King Fredrik III of Denmark was chosen as Archbishop of Bremen. He did however not have much control over his new possession that was devastated by the Thirty Years War and occupied by pillaging mercenary troops.

Actions

A. OK

  • The capital province revolts
  • +50 relations with Denmark
  • Event 159100 - Fredrik of Denmark is elected Archbishop of Bremen for Denmark is triggered immediately

Back to top

133008. Fredrik of Denmark is elected Archbishop of Bremen

Bremen — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 133007 - Fredrik III of Denmark, the last Archbishop of Bremen for Bremen has already occurred
  • None of the following must occur:
    • Event 159100 - Fredrik of Denmark is elected Archbishop of Bremen for Denmark has already occurred
    • Bremen and Denmark are allied
    • Bremen and Denmark are at war

Will happen within 20 days of September 30, 1634
Checked again every 20 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after April 10, 1648)

Description

With his new throne Fredrik brought Denmark into Bremen's alliance.

Actions

A. Vivat!

  • Gain an alliance with Denmark
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill +2 for 12 months

133010. Friesland still supports the pirates

Bremen — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Friesland and Bremen are at war

Triggered by

Action B of 171005 - Pressure of the Hanse for Friesland

Description

We cannot tolerate such activities...

Actions

A. Act, but not at once

  • Discover Breslau
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Friesland for 72 months

B. War!

  • Discover Breslau
  • Start a war with Friesland
  • +5 relations with Denmark
  • +25 relations with Mecklenburg
  • +15 relations with Holstein
  • +5 relations with Oldenburg

Back to top

133009. Response of the Papacy to Luther

Bremen — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 100 - Reformation for all countries

Description

After receiving checked for heresy and forwarded Luther's letter, Leo X responded over the next three years, ''with great care as is proper,'' by deploying a series of papal theologians and envoys against Luther. Perhaps he hoped the matter would die down of its own accord, because in 1518 he dismissed Luther as ''a drunken German'' who ''when sober will change his mind''.

Actions

A. Luther will change his mind...

  • Discover Lazio
  • Change religion to counterreform
